Recently, you may have received in the mail a Pandemic-Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) card. This card is issued by the federal Families First Coronavirus Response Act of 2020 that provides this temporary program. Your child received this card because all students who attend Whitehall City Schools are eligible for free breakfasts and lunches through the federally-funded National School Lunch Program (NSLP) of which Whitehall City Schools is registered as a Provision II district. The P-EBT program is locally administered by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services.

There is nothing you need to sign up for or register. You can receive more information for this program by going to Ohio Job and Family Services website here: http://ohiopebt.org/

If you have any questions, please contact 1-866-244-0071.

On Thursday, May 7th from 6:30pm – 7:30pm, IKIC College Advising Managers and financial aid experts will share tips with students and parents to help you better understand your financial aid options during a LIVE Zoom broadcast, which will also be streamed on the I Know I Can Facebook page.

During this live event, topics will include:

· How to compare financial aid award letters to learn how much you will owe to attend the college of your choice

· How to file a financial aid appeal, if needed

· What to do if you are in FAFSA verification

· Additional costs which may be required to attend college

The session will also feature a live Q&A segment to answer audience questions.

This is a FREE event for students and parents. Registration for the event is requested, but not required, and will be open at 12pm on Monday, May 4th at www.iknowican.org.

We hope you can join us to learn more about your financial aid packages before you make your final college decision.

Congratulations to Etna Road Elementary Teacher, Patrice Archer, for receiving the Ohio Department of Education's TORCH Award!

The Teachers of Ohio Representing Character and Heart (TORCH) recognition honors five extraordinary teachers annually by celebrating their efforts to model strong character and a heart for their students, colleagues and communities. TORCH recipients should demonstrate dedication to equity and personal commitments to their students.

At Etna Road Elementary's staff meeting this morning on Zoom, Patrice was surprised by her Principal, Jessica Moore, and fellow coworkers along with representatives from the Ohio Department of Education. Principal Moore nominated Patrice for the award months ago and was recently notified by ODE that Patrice would be receiving the award!

After the Zoom meeting, Jessica coordinated a socially distant celebration at Patrice's house to officially give her the award. NBC4 even showed up to record the momentous occasion! Their story should air at 5:15 PM tonight.

Congratulations, Patrice!

It was Career Day at Etna Road Elementary today!

Students got dressed up as their favorite professionals while real professionals rotated from class to class to talk to them about their careers.

They had people from all types of careers in the building including an artist, a photographer from the Columbus Dispatch, members of Whitehall's fire and police departments, an Ohio State Highway Patrol Trooper, an architect, a yoga instructor, a lawyer, a judge and many more. One 5th Grade class got to Skype with video journalists from the BBC!

It was a great day with a lot of inspired young minds!
